pull.title: refactor: Remove Qt function to disable menu icons on macOS
pull.body:
As menu icons were removed in #16612, this removes an unnecessary function for macOS
Could this get into v0.19.0?

verification.payload:
tree 351712318813dfd20d1ba1deff55d6564b14e498
parent ab765c2ec7db042142298cdd6ca9c2f04cca8598
author Emil Engler <me@emilengler.com> 1569519736 +0200
committer Emil Engler <me@emilengler.com> 1569519736 +0200

refactor: Remove Qt function to disable menu icons on macOS

events.message: refactor: Remove Qt function to disable menu icons on macOS

events.body: What is the risk of leaving it in?

@MarcoFalke There is no risk but what's the point of leaving useless code in there?
It just makes the program slower and bigger (even if there is no notable change)

I believe this also affects context menus, not sure if we are using them with icons?

Edit: apparently not, for instance:

https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/blob/6288f15f50ab98b336ab86804c4cbea3807dc1d3/src/qt/platformstyle.cpp#L12-L25

And 

https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/blob/6288f15f50ab98b336ab86804c4cbea3807dc1d3/src/qt/addressbookpage.cpp#L67-L77
I didn't touch context menus in my PR at least.

utACK 3eea6a8f2686352a0fd868fee6af42ef1283bdda
AFAIK context menu icons are not shown on macOS, also not when starting with `-uiplatform=other` (or `windows`).

> On my X11 GTK system I don't have any icons in context menus though.

Do we even have icons in context menus? I don't think so. Mind that "getImagesOnButtons()" is about images on *buttons*, not menus.

> Mind that "getImagesOnButtons()" is about images on buttons, not menus.

Yup, I got it wrong while reading https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/blob/79aeed8e76e8bc70722e6178678b0b3840694d5c/src/qt/addressbookpage.cpp#L67-L70

I thought these actions were for the context menu, but actually they are buttons.
